definition: (in former times) to bind one's hair on coming of age
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]

sentences.english: His wife of 63 years, Mary, predeceased him by 11 months.
sentences.chinese: 和他結髮63年的妻子瑪麗先於他11個月離開人世。

sentences.english: In this book we also discuss nonlasing heterojunction diodes .
sentences.chinese: 本書也討論了非激光型的異質結髮光二極管。

sentences.english: Hair comb has a meaning, refers to the spouse can spend the love, forever.
sentences.chinese: 梳子有着結髮的寓意，指配偶能相守相愛，白頭偕老。

sentences.english: Child node inflammation, ear swelling, stiff, pain.
sentences.chinese: 孩子淋巴結髮炎，耳後腫大，發硬，疼痛。

definition: lit. to lift the tray to eyebrow level (idiom); mutual respect in a marriage
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
fig. the man sings and the woman follows/fig. marital harmony
chastity/virginity (of women)/moral integrity (of men)/loyalty/constancy
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
source of calamity (esp. of women)
lit. both sleeves flowing in the breeze (idiom); having clean hands/uncorrupted/unsoiled by corrupt practices
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
to drown one's sorrows (in alcohol)
seriously ill and about to die
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
